dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Sammy b DJ Bravo 102 (83b 13x4 2x6 120m) SR: 122.89

dismissalComment.html: Kohli falls, but to the final ball of the innings. He gets a length ball, tries to clear deep midwicket, but can't. Just doesn't get the elevation on this. Kohli has done the job, though

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c DM Bravo b Roach 69 (77b 8x4 2x6 102m) SR: 89.61

dismissalComment.html: and Dhawan falls to his own confidence. He has shifted gears of late, and this time got a length ball on the pads, and naturally went to hit it. However, he hasn't budgeted for the deep square leg, and has holed out

headshotImage.caption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another fast bowler comes back and takes a wicket first ball of the new spell. Seems to have been done in by the line and the pace. Backs away to try to back-cut a length ball that is not too wide, and Best takes the edge gleefully

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and a wicket with the first ball of the Powerplay. Dug in short, down the leg side, Ramdin collects after Karthik tries to pull. Ramdin hardly appeals, but Best does heartily, and it is given. Karthik is not happy, and it doesn't seem to have hit the glove. There is a clear case for show of dissent. Even Kohli looks very angry
Gone! Good catch from at slip. Raina opens the face of the bat and the ball runs off the face and straight into Sammy's hands

dismissalComment.html: another short ball gets India a wicket. This is surreal. Indian fans won't mind this at all, though. Short again, rising towards the chest again, handcuffs him on the pull, and square leg runs to his right to judge the catch well

dismissalText.commentary: Kemar Roach b Jadeja 34 (33b 3x4 2x6 49m) SR: 103.03

dismissalComment.html: Jadeja finishes it off. India claim the bonus point. This is full and straight, Roach plays across the line, is hit on the pad, and then on the stumps

And Bhuvneshwar provides a breakthrough in his first spell again. There is a drizzle in the air, but it doesn't affect BK's seam. The ball lands on the seam, short of a length, just outside off, and it breaks away and kicks a little. Gayle cannot control it, and edges it through. Outside the playing field, Dhoni applauds too

look at where Bravo is looking, and look where the ball is. He plonks the front foot down and wants to drive this wide of mid-off, but is nowhere near this length ball, and edges it to Ashwin for a comfortable catch at first slip. All through, Bravo is looking towards extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: one more bites the dust. Golden duck for Pollard. Pace and bounce here. Short of a lenght, rising towards the chest, Pollard arches back and jabs at it. Ashwin takes another catch at slip. Have India found a slip catcher? And more importantly, a place for Ashwin?

and Yadav strikes first ball. A straight full ball, angling in, Ramdin is slightly early into this on-side shot, and the leading edge carries to the left of mid-off, who has enough time to come under it

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: stays low, skids through, jags back in from outside off, beats the inside edge, and is given out lbw. I think it is headed down leg, but I am waiting for a replay. And I am wrong. bravo had moved too far across, and was dead plumb

slower offcutter, and Yadav has three wickets in three overs. Sammy is not too pleased. He thinks this is cutting too much, but umpire Llong says it is hitting the stumps. And he is right again. Sammy completely done in by the change of pace, and the movement off the track

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

dismissalText.commentary: Kemar Roach b Jadeja 34 (33b 3x4 2x6 49m) SR: 103.03

commentPreTextItems.html: A heated argument between Jadeja aand Raina during the break. Does it have anything to do with that catch dropped earlier? In comes Tino Best

commentTextItems.html: Jadeja finishes it off. India claim the bonus point. This is full and straight, Roach plays across the line, is hit on the pad, and then on the stumps

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all we have from T&T. Join us on Tuesday for the match between West Indies and Sri Lanka

"We got to give the credit to the Indian batters," says Dwayne Bravo. "Especially Virat. We could have done a lot better with our chase. We have got to regroup for the match against Sri Lanka. We can't afford to make the same mistakes again. We accept our defeat today, but we are still in a strong position, and come Sunday we have to give a better account of ourselves. Coming back after the rain, the conditions helped seam bowling. And they bowled really well."

"More than that, I am happy we won with a bonus point," says Virat Kohli, who is also the Man of the Match. "We got a good start. It's a bit of a tricky situation if you go in after a good start. You don;t know whether to play yourself in or go after the bowlers. To get a hundred in my second game as captain, I am pretty happy. I was getting good starts, but hitting that one shot straight to the fielder, so I was waiting for this big innings."

Except for that ninth-wicket partnership that India should have ended much earlier, this is a perfect game for India. Update on Jadaina situation first: more heated argument between Raina and Jadeja. Jadeja walks away from Raina, but eventually they walk off the field together. Just to remind you, Raina had missed that catch off Jadeja's bowling, and then when Jadeja eventually got the wicket, the two seemed to be arguing

Anyway, it shouldn't take the sheen off a superb performance by India otherwise. Right from the opening stand between Dhawan and Sharma, and the finish by Kohli who brought up his 14th ODI century. With the ball, Bhuvneshwar showed why it was a mistake to drop him in the previous match. And once the rain spiced up the pitch, the Indian seamers were nigh unplayable. India now have five points, which is level with Sri Lanka, but Sri Lanka's NRR is better. West Indies still at the top. Hang on for quotes from the presentation

dismissalText.commentary: Sunil Narine c I Sharma b Jadeja 21 (33b 0x4 2x6 36m) SR: 63.63

commentTextItems.html: finally India get a wicket. Finally Narine falls. He makes room, tries to go over cover, but he doesn't have that much space to swing, and finds long-off
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to extra cover
down the wicket to try the big loft, gets an inside edge to short fine leg

commentPreTextItems.html: This is West Indies' highest ninth-wicket stand at home

commentTextItems.html: short of a length, turning in, defended to leg

commentPreTextItems.html: He goes round the stumps now

commentTextItems.html: short of a lenght, outside off, punched away for a single to point. The bonus-point-avoiding target now comes down to 50

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

commentPreTextItems.html: "Forget Ashwin, Can someone tell Umesh to bowl over the wicket ?" Mr J, ha ha

commentTextItems.html: slower ball again, and Narine is solid in defence
slower ball, he covers the off-stump line and opens the face late to get a single
heaves at a length ball outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
another wide. This bouncer is clearly way too high
big wide down the leg side. Well done to Karthik to keep the damage down to just one with a full-length dive
short, Roach moves across to get inside the line, and pulls it fine of fine leg for four more. Now they need 54 to avoid the bonus point
short, outside off, he flashes, and is beaten
and now Narine rubs it in by jumping down the wicket and lofting him for a six over long-on

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

commentTextItems.html: Narine is missed this time. He is down the wicket, gets too much under the ball, and lofts it towards long-on. Bhuvneshwar and Raina are both calling for it but neither of them is listening, and at the last moment they both pull out of it. Both have misjudged it
short, turning in, cramps him up. Defended to off
length ball, turning in, defended to leg
short of a length, flat, punched away to deep cover for one

commentPreTextItems.html: Yogesh: "Can someone tell Ashwin to bowl over the wicket and so he can get better spin asball turns a lot and he can bowl it outside the off."

commentTextItems.html: length ball, on off, swept away, over midwicket, gets a flat four

image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c DM Bravo b Roach 69 (77b 8x4 2x6 102m) SR: 89.61

dismissalComment.html: and Dhawan falls to his own confidence. He has shifted gears of late, and this time got a length ball on the pads, and naturally went to hit it. However, he hasn't budgeted for the deep square leg, and has holed out

headshotImage.caption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c †Ramdin b Best 46 (78b 5x4 0x6 124m) SR: 58.97

dismissalComment.html: another fast bowler comes back and takes a wicket first ball of the new spell. Seems to have been done in by the line and the pace. Backs away to try to back-cut a length ball that is not too wide, and Best takes the edge gleefully

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Sammy b Samuels 10 (14b 0x4 1x6 18m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Good catch from at slip. Raina opens the face of the bat and the ball runs off the face and straight into Sammy's hands

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tino Best player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Karthik c †Ramdin b Best 6 (7b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: and a wicket with the first ball of the Powerplay. Dug in short, down the leg side, Ramdin collects after Karthik tries to pull. Ramdin hardly appeals, but Best does heartily, and it is given. Karthik is not happy, and it doesn't seem to have hit the glove. There is a clear case for show of dissent. Even Kohli looks very angry

headshotImage.caption: M Vijay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: M Vijay player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: M Vijay player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: M Vijay player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Murali Vijay c Charles b Pollard 27 (18b 5x4 0x6 21m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: and Pollard lets a roar out after getting Vijay out. Vjay backs away again, gets a short ball, wants to cut it over the square field on the off side. The ball, though, stops on him, and he ends up cutting it straight to point. Pollard punches the air

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Devon Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja run out (sub [DS Smith]/DJ Bravo) 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, driven straight to cover, Jadeja wants one, Kohli doesn't. Jadeja is sent back, substitute Devon Smith lobs the ball back to Bravo, and Jadeja is caught short

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Sammy b DJ Bravo 102 (83b 13x4 2x6 120m) SR: 122.89

dismissalComment.html: Kohli falls, but to the final ball of the innings. He gets a length ball, tries to clear deep midwicket, but can't. Just doesn't get the elevation on this. Kohli has done the job, though

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c †Karthik b Kumar 10 (13b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: And Bhuvneshwar provides a breakthrough in his first spell again. There is a drizzle in the air, but it doesn't affect BK's seam. The ball lands on the seam, short of a length, just outside off, and it breaks away and kicks a little. Gayle cannot control it, and edges it through. Outside the playing field, Dhoni applauds too

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johnson Charles player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Johnson Charles c Raina b I Sharma 45 (39b 6x4 2x6 66m) SR: 115.38

dismissalComment.html: another short ball gets India a wicket. This is surreal. Indian fans won't mind this at all, though. Short again, rising towards the chest again, handcuffs him on the pull, and square leg runs to his right to judge the catch well

dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo c Ashwin b Kumar 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: look at where Bravo is looking, and look where the ball is. He plonks the front foot down and wants to drive this wide of mid-off, but is nowhere near this length ball, and edges it to Ashwin for a comfortable catch at first slip. All through, Bravo is looking towards extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c †Karthik b I Sharma 6 (20b 1x4 0x6 34m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: and it doesn't matter what happened last ball. Sharma has his man. Short of a length again, seams a touch again, and this time Samuels has clearly edged it. Sharma is pumped

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard c Ashwin b Kumar 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: one more bites the dust. Golden duck for Pollard. Pace and bounce here. Short of a lenght, rising towards the chest, Pollard arches back and jabs at it. Ashwin takes another catch at slip. Have India found a slip catcher? And more importantly, a place for Ashwin?

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dwayne Bravo lbw b Yadav 14 (29b 0x4 1x6 43m) SR: 48.27

dismissalComment.html: stays low, skids through, jags back in from outside off, beats the inside edge, and is given out lbw. I think it is headed down leg, but I am waiting for a replay. And I am wrong. bravo had moved too far across, and was dead plumb

dismissalText.commentary: Denesh Ramdin c Kumar b Yadav 9 (17b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 52.94

dismissalComment.html: and Yadav strikes first ball. A straight full ball, angling in, Ramdin is slightly early into this on-side shot, and the leading edge carries to the left of mid-off, who has enough time to come under it

dismissalText.commentary: Daren Sammy lbw b Yadav 12 (13b 1x4 1x6 17m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: slower offcutter, and Yadav has three wickets in three overs. Sammy is not too pleased. He thinks this is cutting too much, but umpire Llong says it is hitting the stumps. And he is right again. Sammy completely done in by the change of pace, and the movement off the track

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Kemar Roach b Jadeja 34 (33b 3x4 2x6 49m) SR: 103.03

dismissalComment.html: Jadeja finishes it off. India claim the bonus point. This is full and straight, Roach plays across the line, is hit on the pad, and then on the stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: finally India get a wicket. Finally Narine falls. He makes room, tries to go over cover, but he doesn't have that much space to swing, and finds long-off

stories.title: What makes Bhuvneshwar a threat?
stories.subTitle: West Indies v India, tri-series, Port-of-Spain
stories.seoTitle: Aakash Chopra: What makes Bhuvneshwar Kumar a threat?
stories.summary: On the face of it Bhuvneshwar Kumar has no quality that's likely to catch a layman's fancy. But face him with a bat in hand and you'll know his worth
stories.byline: Aakash Chopra at Queen's Park Oval

stories.title: Bonus-point relief for Kohli
stories.subTitle: West Indies v India, tri-series, Port-of-Spain
stories.summary: Virat Kohli, in his second match as captain, smacked an 83-ball 102 to power India to a tall score against West Indies, but he said more than his innings, India earning a bonus point was more satisfying

stories.title: All-round India crush West Indies
stories.subTitle: West Indies v India, tri-series, Port-of-Spain
stories.summary: Virat Kohli led by example with a blistering 102 off 83 balls to lift India to an imposing 311 before the seamers consigned the match to a no-contest even before the halfway stage

21.9 Points 21.9.1 Preliminary Matches In a competition with three or four Members with ODI status and with a final match or series, the home Board will institute a points system as follows: Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. 21.9.2 Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. 21.9.3 Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. Refer Appendix 6. 21.9.4 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.
